reviewText: A scared illegal immigrant witnesses a homicide and comes to a Texas sheriff played by Brad Johnson. But, the case is not easy, considering who  is the murderer. What complicates this story even further is that the  Sheriff falls passionately in love with the witness. It's that aspect that  we adore with 4 stars. *G*

It was just ok.  I am surprised by so many 4-5 star ratings.  The movie isn't well acted by most of the cast.  The Hispanics are stereotypical at best and deliver their lines like wooden characters from some old spaghetti western.  The cliche fest never ends, with every possible turn.  Every line and plot story has been taken from other movies.  I watched and didn't hate it, but it wasn't very good really.  3 stars is generous.

Mostly I am bugged that Amazon forces us to now write reviews just to rate a movie.
Cheesy...fake political agenda crap.

Spoiler alert: It's like a made-for-tv film that promotes illegal immigration. Please, do not confuse this with the "honor" of the original "Texas lawman". There is no honor in this film. The good cops and the bad cops break the law as a way of doing business. The bad cops use and deal cocaine over the border, and the good cops turn a blind eye to this and illegal immigration, until a rich couple are killed and the sheriff falls in love with a Mexican woman. Then, the drug running is bad, but illegal immigration is still okay. The bad cops turn a blind eye to human trafficking, although it is unclear why. It isn't connected to their drugs, but they mention it is a source of income for them? It isn't clear. The sheriff marries his illegal girlfriend, and her illegal friends are released from jail and get to stay. No mention is ever made of her family who she promised to bring over. The movie gives the impression that the entire town supports illegals, but the only thing we see is the diner. It is an old-time western without the values, or I should say upside down values. If you remember the old westerns, you probably won't like it, but if you are in your twenties, you might, although the quality will annoy you.
good movie

Gritty drama about family loyalty, love, and ambition gone very wrong. Irrelevant that the movie is set on the U.S./Mexican border. It could be set on the U.S/Canadian border, or the Chile/Argentinian border. Solid story that transcends country and language.

I watched the whole thing.  It was not bad, but I didn't really find it entertaining. Story highlights the desperation of immigrants trying to enter country illegally, but with a lot of bad patrolmen doing bad things.  It was decent acting but the storyline was pretty depressing.  Not fit for children/teens to watch (some nudity/sexual abuse, bad cops doing bad things, lots of killing to cover up bad deeds, etc.)  However, despite that assessment, I did watch the whole thing (although there was one point I almost turned it off).  The ending was decent, although improbable given the storyline.
It has every old tired cliche and stereotype seen many many times before. Nothing new or interesting. Disappointing.

This felt like a B movie that you might see at an old drive-in movie theater. The quality and acting sometimes weren't stellar, and it was a little cliche at times, though I did enjoy the bathing scenes, LOL! All in all, this was a feel good movie. I gave it 5 stars because that's what I tend to do when I enjoy a movie. I rarely write reviews when I don't enjoy a movie, but this movie made feel good, and it had a moral lesson. If your looking for all-star class and Hollywood blockbuster class production values then you won't be happy here, but if you overlook its flaws it's a real gem!

Amazon Prime sent me four recommendations and I added all four to my Watchlist. Three and a half DESPERATE Stars. Across the Line (aka Deadly Crossing) is a 2000 film where a small town sheriff is caught in a web of intrigue involving politics, foreign harassment, illegal border crossings, budding friendships, and heinous crimes. The plot also covers a strong, smart, desperate female. Brad Johnson, Sigal Erez, Marshall Teague, and Brian Bloom are excellent in their roles. There are also very good performances by Justin Urich, Julio Dolce Vita, Carlos Carrasco, Luis Contreras, Mark Adair-Rios, Stephen Spacek, Roger Velasco, Julia Vera, Steve Vinovich, Courtney Gebgart and John Vargas with a cameo by Adrienne Barbeau. Directed by Martin Spottl who co-wrote the script and co-produced the film with lead actress Sigal Erez. Very Definitely Recommended as a good border patrol, immigrant film with a wild plot. Three and a half MURDEROUS Stars. (Multicom Entertainment Group, Inc. AMCO Entertainment Group. Rated R for violence, profanity and nudity. Color. HD. CC. X-Ray is not functional. Time-1:39:42.)

The producers and writers of this movie should be ashamed of themselves. The US Border Patrol have a difficult and dangerous job. And they have proven themselves to be the most honest and courageous law enforcement arm of the federal government. To depict them as killers, drug dealers, rapists and drug users is ridiculous. Equally as ridiculous is to portray (or infer) that all illegal aliens are essentially political refugees like Sigal Erez's character and her relatives. The movie is a typical propaganda hit piece targeted against the sovereignty of our borders--an especially dangerous message to send in the times we live in. A final thought in the form of a question, was the infantile plot written by a studio intern?

In most cases I don't believe it is like that at all.  What about drugs/violent crimes/terrorist , etc?  It was definately made for illegals to enjoy & they are probably laughing their b...s off at the irony of it & the stupidity of America.  Threw the movie away. ACROSS THE LINE is an earnest, thoughtful film about the plight of illegal immigrants, but as an action or thriller, it's only borderline.  Director Martin Spottl keeps things moving at a good pace, but much of the action borders on the improbable and fills some of the roles too stereotypically.  Sigal Eraz who stars as Miranda co-wrote the script and she infuses a sense of wonder and awe in these Guatemalan natives who think everything in America will be wonderful.  The realistic fact that America has its share of no goodnicks hits home hard.  Brad Johnson is a sturdy, heroic figure as the sheriff who faces losing an election, until his crooked brother steps in.  The plot basically revolves around Eraz who witnesses the border patrol (led by a sinister Brian Bloom) off a bunch of drug dealers they were dealing with and also a vacationing couple (an underused Adrienne Barbeau as the wife) who happened to witness the crime.  The late character actor JC Quinn has a nice role as a restaurant proprietor, and Justin Urich does a good job as the naive rookie who ends up getting caught in the mechanisms of Bloom's nastiness.

Although it doesn't set any standards for novelty in this genre, ACROSS THE LINE is diverting entertainment.

Sigal Erez is awesome!  She should be in more movies.  The film takes several unexpected twists and unveils with a quiet cool intelligence.  If you like John Sayles, "Lone Star", then you'll like this.
I enjoyed watching Across the Line, the director Martin Spottl, captures the Latino experience in America. This movie is worth a watch. Enjoy it as I did!

This movie makes a powerful drama of the border, and I think that it's the  acting that achieves the power.  Sigal Erez plays the protagonist Miranda  brilliantly.  Martin Spottl's direction is so smart that you won't even  notice it until you look again, later.  The blazing but empty desert and  the danger in the night are equally and memorably filmed here, in a  fast-moving (and emotionally moving) film you should see many times.  I  know I will.

In the wonderfully scripted, and well Directed "Across the  Line," writer, Sigal Eriz, and Director & Co-writer, Martin Spottl  have managed to make a movie, that I consider "CROSSOVER" - as in  C&W music crossing over into the mainstream.  It's not a Latino film,  it's not an American film.  It's Universal.  It's a "Love Story."  - It will appeal to all!  This script is a perfect example of a work which  shows a slice of life of a young, Latina "illegal," immigrant.  I  don't want to give away any of the details of the story, this is not a  "review" -  This is my way of letting people know that there are  as many latino, Asian, (Fill in your ethnic group here), and other stories  out there to be lived, told, written, Produced, Directed, and released  Theatrically that could rake in piles of $  ------  If a smart Hollywood  Producer would just say to himself, "Hmmm, in California alone the  Latin population is OVER 50% --------I should be able to get some of their  moolah by Producing some Latino scripts."

Loved it! finally a simple good old story.
I wish to see those filmmakers again, maybe a TV series.
The director did a great job, the actress also wrote it. It shows both side of immigration.
Highly recommended !
All that was missing was a late 80's Jan Hammer soundtrack.
A touch of almost reality
movie looks good but difficult to hear and has no subtitles

amzing..

Saved only by the acting of a couple standouts, this on-the-border crime drama crawls along ensuring it checks each and every trope off the list along the way. Only worth a desperation watch when you can't find anything else decent. Took me four or five days to watch it piecemeal just to get through it.
Watch this only if you want to see a lot of bad acting and a pro-illegal alien movie. Couldn't finish it.
Good Movie

So Bad. Yes this is a very, very bad movie. If you are expecting nothing at all in terms of character development, dramatic tension, original story line and good acting etc. then this is what you are looking for.
On the other hand I did watch it start to finish, mostly because I was too lazy to cue up another. But I am also curious now about the entire movie production business and how something so menial could have been made. Obviously someone had to invest cash to make it happen, tho, so how does this all work?
I mean, while on the one hand it seems to be money wasted, on the other it is sort of nice to know that apparently anyone can make a movie and get it  distributed. So maybe this is good for moving making wanna bees?
And all you haters can spare me the loser conspiracy leftie rightie crap. You are worse than the movie...
